section.title: Cactify Task
section.p: The task cactify allows the enhancement of an existing web-application archive (WAR) with the elements needed to run Cactus in-container tests. This includes adding the definitions of the test redirectors to the deployment descriptor, as well as adding the libraries that Cactus requires on the server side (see the Classpath Howto for details).
section.note: If you want to use the HttpUnit integration in your tests, you'll need to explicitly add the httpunit.jar to the cactified WAR. You can easily do this by using a nested <lib> element.
section.p: The cactify task extends the built-in Ant task war, so it also supports all attributes and nested elements that war supports.

section.title: Parameters
section.p: As this task is an extension of the war task, it also supports all attributes that the war task supports. In addition, you can specify the URL-patterns to map the Cactus test redirectors to which the nested elements filterredirector, jspredirector and servletredirector. If you don't specify those elements, the test redirectors will be mapped to the default URL-pattern.

tr.td: The location of the cactified web-application archive

The original web-application archive that is going to be cactified. If this attribute is not specified, a new web-app archive will be created. You'll need to specify the version attribute in that case.

Allows the specification of a web deployment descriptor whose content will get merged into the resulting descriptor. This is only required for purposes like adding special security constraints for testing, as the Cactus test redirectors will be added to the cactified deployment descriptor anyway. The merging of the descriptors is based on the same principles as used by the webxmlmerge task.
The version of the web application archive to create if no source archive has been specified with the srcfile attribute. Can be either 2.2 or 2.3.
No, unless the srcfile attribute is omitted

section.title: Nested Elements
section.note: As this task is an extension of the war task, it also supports all the nested elements supported by the war task.

section.title: filterredirector
section.p: The filterredirector element lets you specify the URL pattern to which the Cactus filter test redirector is mapped in the web application.

tr.td: The URL-pattern to which the redirector should be mapped. Must start with a forward slash ("/").

section.note: This element will be ignored for Servlet 2.2 web applications.

section.title: jspredirector
section.p: The jspredirector element lets you specify the URL pattern to which the Cactus JSP test redirector is mapped in the web application.

tr.td: The URL-pattern to which the redirector should be mapped. Must start with a forward slash ("/").

section.title: servletredirector
section.p: The servletredirector element lets you specify the URL pattern to which the Cactus servlet test redirector is mapped in the web application.

tr.td: The URL-pattern to which the redirector should be mapped. Must start with a forward slash ("/").
